summary: "Little Miss Sunshine" is a 2006 American funny-sad movie about a dysfunctional family driving to a beauty pageant. Directed by Jonathan Dayton and Valerie Faris, it stars Greg Kinnear, Steve Carell, and Toni Collette. The film, made for $8 million, was a big hit, earning $101 million. It got lots of praise and won several awards, including two Oscars for Best Original Screenplay and Best Supporting Actor (Alan Arkin). Young actress Abigail Breslin was also nominated for an Oscar.
title: Little Miss Sunshine
